questions.question: She didn’t want ……………………
questions.description: Want is usually followed by object + infinitive. That-clauses are not normally used after want.

questions.question: Why don’t you let me ………………………?
questions.description: Some verbs are followed by object + infinitive without to. Let is one of them.

questions.question: I watched the kids ………………………… in the garden.
questions.description: Watch is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: I heard her ………………………….. the door and go out.
questions.description: Heard is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I suggested ………………………… consult a doctor.
questions.description: Suggest cannot be followed by object + infinitive.

questions.question: You are advised ……………………………. early.
questions.description: Passive forms of advise can be followed by object + infinitive.

questions.question: Is it the first time ……………………………. here?
questions.description: Here the expression first time has no subject relationship with the following verb and hence the infinitive structure is not possible here.

questions.question: She is the oldest athlete …………………… an Olympic medal.
questions.description: Superlatives can usually be followed by an infinitive structure. The meaning is very similar to an identifying relative clause.

questions.question: I saw him .................................... the money.
questions.description: After see, the infinitive is used without to.

questions.question: You don't look happy ....................................... me.
questions.description: Happy is followed by an infinitive with to.
